name: Century Plaza Hotel & Spa

reviews.title: Awful! Stay away from this hotel! ** must read! **
reviews.text: Worst experience I have EVER have with a hotel, and that is saying a lot!

I booked this hotel through expedia and looked at pictures and descriptions and when we walked in, we were so (so so very) disappointed! It was my 3 year anniversary with my spouse. We live just outside Vancouver, and we had saved up money just to spend the weekend away together for something special.
reviews.title: 5 fabulous nights
Almost perfect for the price
reviews.text: First of all, there was major construction going on and there was a really strong smell of paint and drywall and dust. Within 5 minutes of waiting to check in, I already had a headache and was beginning to get an itchy throat and eyes (I have allergies, but they aren't usually very sensitive).

reviews.title: what's the fuss??
reviews.text: We got our room keys and went up to the room. The whole journey to our room smelled terribly of the constuction, and then cigarette smoke.

reviews.title: Okay for the price
reviews.text: Our room was no better. The smoke smell was disgusting, and there were cigarette burns in the carpets and furniture. I had requested a non smoking because of health problems where smoke gives me a big problem, and this was clearly NOT a non-smoking room.

reviews.title: Great location but has issues
reviews.text: This hotel has a great location in downtown Vancouver. It is within easy walking distance of Robson st. shopping and the skytrain.
It has a nice pool but no spa, just a sauna. The on-site cafe is serviceable but after one meal there we ate elsewhere.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: The rooms have kitchenette facilities and small balconies which provide incredible city views.
reviews.title: Good value for money!
Drive straight past!!!
reviews.text: There is a parking garage on premises for $10. a night.

reviews.title: Location was the only plus here
reviews.text: Now for the negatives. When we arrived late on a very warm August night we went to our one bedroom suite to find that we had a room with no air conditioning. Two large fans helped but it was still unacceptably warm. A call to the front desk resulted in a change the next day to an air conditioned room. However we should have been given the air conditioned one in the first place as we were able to move into one the first thing the next morning so it had been available when we first arrived.

Our family of 4 booked 2 rooms for 4 nights during our trip across western Canada. I was concerned initially because on arrival it is obvious there is refurbishment going on in the reception and lobby area, but in practice we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. As requested the hotel gave us two adjoining rooms on the 20th floor.
reviews.title: 4-night stay

reviews.text: Positive points were that the rooms were large, bright and comfortable. We had a suite with big bedroom and adjoining lounge and kitchen. The views across this residential area towards English Bay and the mountains were outstanding. There were minor niggleswith the room - no safe for valuables, so had to use a safety deposit at reception, and fairly limited cutlery and cooking utensils varying between rooms - but otherwise great. Air conditioning worked well but despite the heat in Vancouver - over 30 degrees - it was sufficient to open the windows and get the breeze.
reviews.title: Great value and enormous rooms
Not Impressed
reviews.text: Points to watch out for are that only two lifts were working some of the time so it can get very busy - as when a youth orchestra was arriving during our stay - and the balcony railings on the 20th floor are much lower than would be allowed in the UK, low waist height.
Restaurant gave reasonable value but we only used for breakfast and tended to eat out. In general the staff were very helpful to us with things like booking taxis, maps and directions etc.
reviews.title: Great budget hotel
Great Value in Vancouver
reviews.text: Would definitely stay again. Location is a strong point on Burrard St, within walking distance of downtown (tourist info, shops, galleries) and in the other direction English Bay, Granville Island. Ask for a room on a higher floor; lower down you won't get the views and might get annoyed with ambulance sirens from the hospital opposite.

5 night stay on package tour.Spacious room (with full kitchenette facilities - microwave, giant fridge, coffee maker, hob/oven) on 11th floor (of 30)with mountain/downtown west-facing view providing stupendous sunsets vista. (Ask for a room facing this way .) Huge beds. Warm. Well lit.(The previous report complaining about the TV position appears to have missed the fact that the room TVs are on turntable furniture!)General decore a little worn but by no means tawdry.Large shower/bathroom.Moderate storage room.
reviews.title: Short Stay

reviews.text: Pleasant staff although concierge advice not always accurate and lacked some local knowledge. Reasonable, quiet, comfortable bar. Chic restaurant offering limited select a la carte menu but tasteful with nice choice of BC wines- Pinot Noir a good buy. Chirpy hotel breakfast/cafe salon open all day.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel - an enjoyable stay!

reviews.text: Near to all down town facilities.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
Couldn't imagine there being a worse hotel in vancouver
reviews.text: One drawback is that an A&E is situated on next block so the occasional (at least two a night)ambulance siren can disturb sleep.Rooms are not double glazed.

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.text: Compared to UK Vancouver is about 20% more expensive. Terrible Art Gallery, loads of stoned non-agressive homeless wander the streets. Dinner in the revolving harbour tower restaurant at night is a must. Excellent choice of city tours. Some absolutely stunning architecture.Walk as much as you can to see it properly - there are thousands of watering holes of various styles along all routes!

description: The Century Plaza Hotel & Spa is a landmark destination hot spot right in the centre of downtown Vancouver. From its award winning amenities including a world class spa and comedy club, to the kitchen equipped suites featuring spectacular ocean, mountain and city views, the family owned and operated Century-Plaza Hotel & Spa has implemented sustainable practices such as its 'Green Initiative' Program as well as the 100% Chemical Free Commercial Cleaning System reducing our carbon footprint to provide guests with the wonderful home away from home ambiance.
